meanings.definition: The quality or state of being mighty or powerful.
meanings.sent1: His mightiness in battle was unmatched by any other warrior.
meanings.sent2: The mightiness of the storm caused widespread damage to the town.
meanings.sent3: The tiny kitten tried to mimic the mightiness of the lion by roaring loudly.
meanings.sent4: The mightiness of the waterfall was both breathtaking and deafening.
meanings.sent5: The mightiness of the ancient castle walls left visitors in awe of its strength.

meanings.definition: The capacity to exert great force or strength.
meanings.sent1: The superhero's mightiness allowed him to lift cars with ease.
meanings.sent2: The mightiness of the engine enabled the train to climb steep hills effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The toddler giggled as he tried to show off his mightiness by lifting a heavy toy.
meanings.sent4: The mightiness of the giant oak tree's roots held firm against the storm's strong winds.
meanings.sent5: The mightiness of the hammerhead shark's bite is a testament to its power in the ocean.

meanings.definition: The impressive or imposing nature of something.
meanings.sent1: The mightiness of the mountain range took their breath away as they stood at its base.
meanings.sent2: The mightiness of the ancient architecture left visitors marveling at its grandeur.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended to be a queen, walking with the mightiness of a ruler.
meanings.sent4: The mightiness of the thunderous applause filled the concert hall with energy.
meanings.sent5: The mightiness of the waterfall's roar echoed through the canyon, creating a powerful sound.
